definition: (sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Chile qualified as second in Group B.
sentences.chinese: 智利隊以B組第二的成績出線。

sentences.english: But it's that confidence on the ball that helps Brazil break out so swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 但正是盧西奧的這份信心使得巴西順利出線。

sentences.english: Here, skysports. com looks at all the qualification permutations in each group.
sentences.chinese: 天空體育在這裏分析了一下各小組的出線形勢。

sentences.english: But two successive defeats Sharapova, the group only theoretically possible.
sentences.chinese: 而兩連敗的莎拉波娃，小組出線僅剩理論上的可能。

sentences.english: United can secure qualification for the Champions League knockout stages if they defeat Benfica at Old Trafford.
sentences.chinese: 如果能主場幹掉本菲卡曼聯就能確保小組出線。

sentences.english: The bottom two teams from each group advance to the Plate semi-finals.
sentences.chinese: 未能出線的兩組進入銀碟準決賽。

sentences.english: South Korea qualified as second in Group B.
sentences.chinese: 韓國隊以B組第二的成績出線。

sentences.english: Adriano Galliani and coach Leonardo underlined the importance of the Milan qualification to the next round of the Champions League.
sentences.chinese: 加里亞尼和萊昂納多強調了米蘭獲取出線權的重要性。

sentences.english: Tighten thew offtrack and cover the connection cover.
sentences.chinese: 擰緊出線嘴，蓋上接線蓋。

definition: to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
St Paul/São Paulo, city in Brazil
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to defend the crown (in sports championship)
